text:
Pt is a 74 yo admitted to MICU 6 with PMH of HTN, Hypothyroidism,
   gallstones, and hyperlipidemia who presented to ED from home with c/o
   increasing LE edema, increasing SOB over last few days.  Pt recently
   dx. with ovarian CA vs. Lymphoma and is undergoing workup
work-up to
   date shows ovarian adenocarcinoma, all data is not in yet.
   Pre-admission abdominal CT with dye load and recent labs revealed
   worsening kidney failure so PCP [**Name (NI) 167**] pt at home and sent pt
   directly to ED.  On admission BUN= 116 and creatinine = 7.2 Pt SOB and
   placed on 4L NC 02 with Sats= 94-96%, K= 7.8 and received kaexylate
   with insulin and D50 and calcium gluconate.  CXR revealed new Large
   Left pleural effusion ->>thorocentesis for 1L bloody fluid, and chest
   tube placed. Worsening respiratory status d/t fluid overload from ARF,
   pleural effusions, ascites,  peri-cardial effusion. Pt started on CRRT
   [**9-16**]. BIPAP on/off. 2^nd left pigtail chest tube placed [**9-17**] with 960
   cc bloody drainage out.
   Shock, hypovolemic or hemorrhagic
   Assessment:
   SBP 90-100 with MAP > 65. PT a+o x 3. HR 94-110 ST.
   Action:
   Weaned levophed down from .08mcgs/kg/min to .06 mcgs/kg/min
   Response:
   SBP falling to low 70s and MAP 55-58
   Plan:
   Continue levophed to maintain MAP > 60.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Tolerating CRRT for fluid removal rate of 50ccs/hr. TFB neg 1250ccs
   yest. BUN/Cr down to 31/1.9 respectively. Urine output improving
   5-35ccs/hr via foley.
   Action:
   Attempted to increase goal removal rate to 100ccs/hr.
   Response:
   BP fell with MAP < 60 and filter and effluent pressures increased.
   Plan:
   Remain with goal fluid removal rate of 50ccs/hr. Follow labs and
   replete lytes per CRRT protocol.
   Pleural effusion, acute
   Assessment:
   02 sats 99-100% on 4 L NC. LS clear, diminished at bases. ABG
   7.41/44/153/3/29. Chest tube #1 with no drainage. Sm amt sanguionous
   drainage from chest tube #2(pig-tail).
   Action:
   O2 decrease to 2 L NC.
   Response:
   Sats remain 98-100%. RR 18-32. Pt denies sob.
   Plan:
   Surgery to remove chest tube #1 today and ? perform pleuradesis with CT
   #2.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt denies pain at c-tube insertion sites. c/o back discomfort from
   lying in bed.
   Action:
   Repositioned freq. Tylenol given. Initially refused ativan but
   eventually agreed to try it. Declined oxycodone.
   Response:
   Pt c/o slight improvement in back discomfort but still awake most of
   the night.
   Plan:
   Encourage use of Tylenol and ativan at bedtime. Freq repositioning and
   skin care.
